question: How long will the procedure take?
answer: The duration of the procedure depends on the density of native eyelashes and on the type of extension that you have chosen.

question: Should I take a break from extensions?
answer: Eyelash extensions are done with respect for native eyelashes, so native eyelashes do not suffer. There is no need to take breaks.

question: How often do you need to refill eyelashes?
answer: It is recommended to refill every 2-3 weeks. So your eyelashes will always look great.

question: Why do I recommend doing a new extension every 2-3 months?
answer: The most important thing in extensions is to thoroughly rinse the inter-eyelash zone. And this can be done as efficiently as possible only with the complete absence of artificial eyelashes.

question: Is it possible to do eyelashes during pregnancy?
answer: Yes, there are no contraindications if you can lie on your back during the procedure.

question: When not to do eyelash extensions?
answer: It is strictly forbidden to do eyelash extensions if you previously had an allergic reaction to eyelash extension glue, in case of any infectious eye lesions. If you have a cough, runny nose or fever, it is recommended to rebook the appointment.

question: Why can't we wet eyelashes 24 hours after the procedure?
answer: This time is necessary for the glue to dry (polymerization) completely.

question: Can I dye my fake lashes with mascara and use eye shadow?
answer: It is possible, but not recommended, to use eye shadow in the space between the eyelashes, because it is difficult to wash them well from there. Cleanliness of the space between the eyelashes is the most important thing.

question: Is it possible to swim in the sea and pool with eyelash extensions?
answer: Yes, salt and fresh water do not affect eyelashes in any way.
